data.name: Phandalin
data.entry: A small frontier town home to farmers, woodcutters, fur traders, and prospectors drawn by stories of gold and platinum in the foothills of the Sword Mountains. The town consists of 40 or 50 simple log buildings, some built on old field stone foundations. More old ruins - crumbling stone walls covered in ivy and briars - surround the newer houses and shops, showing how this must have been a much larger town in centuries past.
data.entry_parsed: A small frontier town home to farmers, woodcutters, fur traders, and prospectors drawn by stories of gold and platinum in the foothills of the Sword Mountains. The town consists of 40 or 50 simple log buildings, some built on old field stone foundations. More old ruins - crumbling stone walls covered in ivy and briars - surround the newer houses and shops, showing how this must have been a much larger town in centuries past.

data.name: Barthen's Provisions
data.entry: Barthen's is the biggest trading post in Phandalin. Its shelves stock most ordinary goods and supplies, including backpacks, bedrolls, rope, and rations. The place is open from sunup to sundown. Barthen's does not stock weapons or armor, but characters can purchase other adventuring gear here, with the exception of items that cost more than 25 gp.
data.entry_parsed: Barthen's is the biggest trading post in Phandalin. Its shelves stock most ordinary goods and supplies, including backpacks, bedrolls, rope, and rations. The place is open from sunup to sundown. Barthen's does not stock weapons or armor, but characters can purchase other adventuring gear here, with the exception of items that cost more than 25 gp.

data.name: Lionshield Coster
data.entry:
Hanging above the front door of this modest trading post is a sign shaped like a wooden shield with a blue lion painted on it.

 

This building is owned by the Lionshields, a merchant company based in the city of Yartar, over a hundred miles to the east. They ship finished good to Phandalin and other small settlements throughout the region.
data.entry_parsed:
Hanging above the front door of this modest trading post is a sign shaped like a wooden shield with a blue lion painted on it.

 

This building is owned by the Lionshields, a merchant company based in the city of Yartar, over a hundred miles to the east. They ship finished good to Phandalin and other small settlements throughout the region.

data.name: Phandalin Miner's Exchange
data.entry: The Miner's Exchange is a trading post where local miners have their valuable finds weighed, measured, and paid out. In the absence of any local lord or authority, the exchange also serves as an unofficial records office., registering claims to various streams and excavations around the area. There isn't any real gold rush in Phandalin, but enough wealth is hidden in nearby streams and valleys to support a good number of independent prospectors.
data.entry_parsed: The Miner's Exchange is a trading post where local miners have their valuable finds weighed, measured, and paid out. In the absence of any local lord or authority, the exchange also serves as an unofficial records office., registering claims to various streams and excavations around the area. There isn't any real gold rush in Phandalin, but enough wealth is hidden in nearby streams and valleys to support a good number of independent prospectors.

data.name: The Sleeping Giant
data.entry: The Sleeping Giant is a ramshackle taproom at the east end of town. This rundown tap house is a dirty, dangerous watering hole at the end of Phandalin's main street. It is frequented by Redbrand thugs and operated by a surly female dwarf named Grista.
data.entry_parsed: The Sleeping Giant is a ramshackle taproom at the east end of town. This rundown tap house is a dirty, dangerous watering hole at the end of Phandalin's main street. It is frequented by Redbrand thugs and operated by a surly female dwarf named Grista.

data.name: The Stonehilll Inn
data.entry: In the center of town stands a large, newly built roadhouse of fieldstone and rough-hewn timbers. The common room is filled with locals nursing mugs of ale or cider, all of them eyeing you with curiosity.
data.entry_parsed: In the center of town stands a large, newly built roadhouse of fieldstone and rough-hewn timbers. The common room is filled with locals nursing mugs of ale or cider, all of them eyeing you with curiosity.

data.name: Shrine of Luck
data.entry: Phandalin's only temple is a small shrine made of stones taken from the nearby ruins. It is dedicated to Tymora, goddess of luck and good fortune.
data.entry_parsed: Phandalin's only temple is a small shrine made of stones taken from the nearby ruins. It is dedicated to Tymora, goddess of luck and good fortune.

data.name: Tresendar Manor
data.entry:
A ruined manor that was once the home of the Tresendar family.

 

The Heroes found:

  • Redbrands
  • Iarno Albrek/Glasstaff
  • Nothic
  • Mirna and her children
  • Ring of Mind Shielding
  • [character:465947]
  • Bugbears

data.name: Neverwinter
data.entry:
A much larger city along the Sword Coast. Where our adventurer's first start out when escorting mining supplies from here to [location:326524]

In 1451, Mt. Hotenow exploded and destroyed large parts of Neverwinter, leaving behind a large chasm in the Southeast quadrant which spewed plaguechanged horrors. In 1467, Lord Dagult Neverember lead the rebuilding efforts, including magically sealing the Chasm in 1484.
data.entry_parsed:
A much larger city along the Sword Coast. Where our adventurer's first start out when escorting mining supplies from here to Phandalin

In 1451, Mt. Hotenow exploded and destroyed large parts of Neverwinter, leaving behind a large chasm in the Southeast quadrant which spewed plaguechanged horrors. In 1467, Lord Dagult Neverember lead the rebuilding efforts, including magically sealing the Chasm in 1484.

data.name: Triboar
data.entry: A town on the Savage Frontier. The town is ruled by a democratically elected Lord Protector.
data.entry_parsed: A town on the Savage Frontier. The town is ruled by a democratically elected Lord Protector.

data.name: Conyberry
data.entry: The town of Conyberry was sacked by barbarians years ago and now lies in ruins. The Triboar Trail runs right through the abandoned town.
data.entry_parsed: The town of Conyberry was sacked by barbarians years ago and now lies in ruins. The Triboar Trail runs right through the abandoned town.
